intro: Lagenophora stipitata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lagenophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
